detail.title: The Impact of Brand Equity on Vertical Integration in Franchise Systems

declarations.funderStatement: Funding for this research was provided by the Institute for the Study of Business Markets (ISBM) at Penn State. However, the contents of this research reflect the views of the researchers who are solely responsible for the facts and the accuracy of the data presented herein. This research is supported by funding for Manish Kacker from the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC). Mohammad Kayed is grateful for the generous financial support from the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (SSHRC) of Canada, award number 767-2016-2275.

detail.abstract:
Brand equity and vertical integration are focal, strategic elements of a franchise system that can profoundly influence franchise performance. Despite the recognized importance of these two strategic levers and the longstanding research interest in the topic, our understanding of the interplay between brand equity and vertical integration (company ownership of outlets) in a franchise system remains incomplete. 

In this study, we revisit the five-decade-old question of how brand equity affects vertical integration in a franchise system and present some novel, nuanced insights into the topic. Evidence from a Bayesian Panel Vector Autoregressive model on a large panel data set shows that brand equity has a powerful, lagging inverse effect on vertical integration, such that higher brand equity leads to less downstream vertical integration in a franchise system. Reverse causality analyses identify a less pronounced but present reciprocal effect. Boundary conditions analyses reveal that the negative effect of brand equity on vertical integration is weaker in franchise systems with international presence and in retail-focused (vs. service-focused) franchises, and stronger in franchise systems with more financial resources. 

These findings (a) challenge traditional views (e.g., transaction cost theory, resource-based view, ownership redirection hypothesis) on the topic by demonstrating a negative effect for brand equity on vertical integration in franchise systems and showing that greater financial resources amplify this effect, and (b) shed new light on the intricate dynamics (temporal causation, reverse causation) and contingencies of this debated effect. Managerially, this research draws attention to the underrecognized strategic benefit of brand equity in mitigating channel governance issues and advise against unnecessary vertical integration, especially when brand equity is robust.

detail.title: Enhancing E-Commerce Fulfilment Operations: Machine Learning for Order Forecasting and Workforce Scheduling
detail.abstract: Warehouse operations are critical for efficient e-commerce fulfillment. This study leverages state-of-the-art forecasting techniques to evaluate their impact on warehouse operations. We assess the operational impact of 90 forecasting models, incorporating techniques such as hierarchical forecasting and global models combined with ensemble methods that leverage classical, machine learning, or deep learning approaches. When employing a multistage stochastic program, our simulation methodology encompasses 5,600 scenario weeks for each model. It indicates an average weekly cost saving of 23.35%, including service level penalties, when using the most effective ensemble model as compared to our benchmark, a SARIMAX model. Our analysis provides deeper insights into how improved forecasts affect service level violations and worker utilization, offering valuable guidance for management decisions.

detail.abstract: This study compares microfinance sector growth under India's UPA and NDA administrations, examining budget allocations, spending, and policy shifts. The analysis reveals significantly higher loan disbursements under the NDA, with 4.8 times more loans overall and an average annual growth rate of 328.1%, compared to 19.2% under the UPA. The NDA period showed greater fluctuations in loan disbursements, suggesting policy shifts and aggressive lending practices. The research explores microfinance's historical development in India, its role in financial inclusion, and economic impact. It also addresses challenges like high-interest rates and regulatory issues. The findings illuminate how political administrations and policies influence the microfinance sector, affecting financial inclusion and economic development in India. This comparative analysis contributes to understanding the interplay between government policies and microfinance growth.

detail.title: The diffusion of a U.S. Trade-Based Approach to International Personal Data Transfers and its Implications for National Data Privacy Regulations

publicationDetails.detailsText: International Data Privacy Law, Volume 14, Issue 4, pp. 352-376

detail.abstract: Acclaimed as an advanced model to regulate the digital economy, US-designed digital trade rules to regulate cross-border data flows have been increasingly dominating the international trade regime through norm diffusion, significantly expanding this template’s regulatory ‘sphere of influence’ among competing norms and standards. From an empirical perspective, this article explores the spread of the American regulatory template in other countries’ preferential trade agreements, demonstrating how US-formulated free data flow provisions have profoundly shaped many third countries’ digital trade rulemaking. Furthermore, this article analyses the normative implications of this trade-based approach for other countries’ domestic data privacy laws, particularly how American-style free data flow provisions may be invoked to scrutinize their EU-style ‘adequacy’ standard to regulate outbound personal data transfers. More broadly, this article compares the normative influence of the American and European approaches to regulating international personal data transfers and discusses the implications of their regulatory rivalry for third countries’ trade and privacy rulemaking.

detail.abstract: Minority entrepreneurs often face unique challenges that impact their business growth and sustainability. This study investigates how resource scarcity and perceived compatibility influence the adoption of marketing consulting services (MCS) among minority entrepreneurs, with perceived relationship quality as a mediating variable. By employing the Resource Dependence Theory and the Unified Theory of Acceptance and Use of Technology (UTAUT), this research provides insights into the factors that drive MCS adoption intentions. The findings highlight the critical role of resource availability, the alignment of services with business needs, and the importance of high-quality business relationships in enhancing entrepreneurial success.

detail.abstract: In the age of social media, Instagram Reels have become a powerful cultural force, shaping the aspirations and identities of millions of young Indians. This paper explores the psychological phenomenon of delusional aspirationsunrealistic dreams of overnight fame, wealth, and status driven by the curated success of influencers. By analyzing behavioral patterns, case studies, and socioeconomic data, the study reveals how short-form content and algorithmic visibility are altering career choices, mental health, and real-world expectations. The paper argues for greater digital literacy, mental resilience, and systemic media accountability to curb the illusion of instant success.

title: How John F. Kennedy's Childhood Trauma and Religious Experiences Influenced His Formation as President
affiliations: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) and Grove City College

detail.title: How John F. Kennedy's Childhood Trauma and Religious Experiences Influenced His Formation as President
detail.abstract: Based on autobiographies, biographies, interviews, and resources from the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum including letters he wrote as a child to his mother and notes to his best friend, this article examines how childhood trauma and various religious experiences influenced the intellectual and spiritual formation of John F. Kennedy. Although the lives of many presidents are well documented, insufficient attention has been paid to the role played by religious mentors who assisted future presidents to cope with trauma they endured as youth. Kennedy's perceptions of his childhood trauma and religious life provide an important lens for understanding his chronic illnesses leading to a life riddled with sickness, back pain, having one leg longer than the other, poor eyesight, and enduring invasive rectal exams. While suffering immensely, Kennedy exuded a calm and affable public persona. How did he survive these maladies that would have caused many others to succumb? This article also closely examines how Kennedy's religious views emerged during his teenage years as he was influenced by his mother, Rose, a devout Catholic. Kennedy's own words and the observations of those close to him provide insight about how his response to these varied afflictions helped him become a world leader who inspired hope.

detail.abstract: This paper presents a conceptual framework for understanding the factors that influence the use of marketing consulting services by businesses that face structural or resource disadvantages. Drawing on Resource Dependence Theory and Social Capital Theory, the study synthesizes findings from existing literature to identify six key determinants of service engagement: access to support ecosystems, availability of clear information, trust in providers, cultural compatibility, perceived service effectiveness, and acquisition convenience. The framework emphasizes the need for tailored outreach, trust-building, and culturally sensitive practices to increase engagement. The study contributes to academic theory by integrating multiple perspectives and offers actionable insights for consultants, nonprofit organizations, and policymakers seeking to improve marketing support for underserved business communities.

title: Stepping Up Child Protection: An Assessment of Child Protection Systems in South Asia, Including Reflections from Other World Regions
affiliations: IGNOU and Independent

detail.title: Stepping Up Child Protection: An Assessment of Child Protection Systems in South Asia, Including Reflections from Other World Regions

keywords: United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC)

detail.abstract: Child protection systems (CPS) across South Asia face persistent and multifaceted challenges. The region, home to nearly one-third of the world's child population, is characterized by stark socioeconomic inequalities, deeprooted cultural practices, fragile governance frameworks, and a chronic shortage of human and financial resources. These factors collectively undermine the effectiveness of CPS, exposing children to a high risk of violence, exploitation, neglect, and abuse. This paper provides a comprehensive assessment of child protection mechanisms in eight South Asian countries-Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka. It explores how national frameworks perform in terms of preventing and responding to core child protection concerns: child labour, child marriage, trafficking, sexual abuse and exploitation, and violence in various forms. The analysis is grounded in international child rights standards, particularly the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC), and assesses how each country aligns with or diverges from these norms. Through a critical examination of legal instruments, institutional arrangements, frontline service delivery, workforce capacity, data systems, and community-based strategies, the study identifies both strengths and structural deficits. For instance, while some countries like Bhutan and the Maldives have made commendable progress in policy articulation and decentralization of child protection services, others like Afghanistan and parts of India still struggle with enforcement, coordination, and coverage-especially in fragile or conflict-affected settings. In recognizing the limitations of the regional context, the paper draws on child protection experiences and models from other world regions. It investigates integrated child welfare approaches from the Nordic countries, community-rooted mechanisms from Sub-Saharan Africa and Latin America, and technological innovations in child data management from OECD nations. These comparative insights offer practical illustrations of how political will, legal reform, and institutional synergy can substantially transform child protection outcomes. Importantly, this paper advocates a paradigm shift in South Asia from reactive to preventive protection strategies. It underscores the need for child-centred, inclusive, and rights-based systems that engage families, schools, law enforcement, civil society, and children themselves as key stakeholders. It recommends building CPS that are not only legally robust and adequately resourced but also socially embedded and culturally responsive. The paper concludes with a set of forward-looking recommendations tailored for the South Asian context. These include legislative reforms, capacity building of child protection personnel, enhanced inter-agency coordination, increased public funding, and participatory monitoring mechanisms. Emphasis is also placed on the importance of collecting disaggregated child protection data, expanding access to justice for children, and designing programs that address the root causes of vulnerability such as poverty, gender inequality, and conflict. By blending regional analysis with global reflections, this paper contributes to a growing body of evidence advocating for holistic, scalable, and context-specific child protection reforms. The aim is to influence policymakers, practitioners, and development partners toward shared accountability in safeguarding the rights and dignity of every child in South Asia.

title: A regulatory framework to enable shared use of the Upper 6 GHz band by IMT and RLAN applications

detail.title: A regulatory framework to enable shared use of the Upper 6 GHz band by IMT and RLAN applications
detail.abstract:
Mobile Network Operators (MNO) have a strong attraction for using the 6425-7125 MHz band, widely known as the “Upper 6 GHz band”, for the development of International Mobile Telecommunications (IMT), while, the same band is also considered for the deployment of Wi-Fi® other Radio Local Area Networks (RLAN) standardized by IEEE 802.11. MNOs seek access to the Upper 6 GHz band to provide a complementary capacity layer for their current 4G/5G access networks on top of their currently allocated bands on the lower and mid bands. The possibility of reaching a thriving use of the band depends on resolving a regulatory conundrum: designing a suitable framework to allow MNOS and RLANs to share the band.

The European Conference of Postal and Telecommunications Administrations (CEPT) and the European National Regulatory Agencies (NRAs) face an enormous challenge when having to review numerous technical studies, which together not only offer a confusing view crowded with diverse technical options and sharing assumptions but also align themselves with one or another proposal. Assuming a market-oriented regulatory framework, a set of technical policy options that would allow the shared use of the U6 band by IMT and RLAN applications has been proposed by the Spectrum Usage Rights (eSUR) framework in [1]. Accordingly, an eSUR-type license should be either perpetual or very long duration; provide interference controls based on power (power flux density) limits for geographical and frequency boundaries and average received power level; be packaged by NRAs to a minimum viable size in both frequency and geographic to make them attractive as a long-term investment; and have no restrictions for trade or sub-lease.

This paper discusses recent European regulatory developments in trying to address this issue, by comparatively analysing the European studies mentioned above vis-a-vis a set of critical issues that focus on the potential for co-existence on the band. The latter would serve as an input to a European regulatory framework that this paper proposes to allow the shared use of the U6 band by IMT and RLAN applications under the market-oriented approach. Building on the eSUR approach, the framework proposed seeks to facilitate the rapid award of flexible and comprehensive spectrum usage rights in the U6 band.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了欧洲在解决移动网络运营商（MNO）和无线局域网（RLAN）共享6 GHz频段（U6频段）的监管框架问题上的最新进展，提出了一种基于市场导向的共享方案。

AI.practical_contributions: 为欧洲监管机构提供了具体的政策建议，以促进U6频段的快速分配和灵活使用。

publicationDetails.detailsText: TESOL Journal, volume 16, issue 3, 2025[10.1002/tesj.70054]

detail.abstract: In this paper, I present my position on why TESOL teachers need to develop their intercultural nonverbal communication competence. While many publications focus on intercultural verbal communication competence in TESOL teacher education, intercultural nonverbal communication competence receives little attention. After defining the concept of intercultural nonverbal communication competence, I propose its theoretical model, arguing that intercultural nonverbal communication competence is relevant and significant to TESOL teachers' classroom practices. This argument is upheld from two perspectives. One, TESOL teachers need to develop their intercultural nonverbal communication competence while interacting with culturally diverse students. They have the responsibility to demonstrate leadership in intercultural sensitivity so that they teach with an intercultural education philosophy and intercultural attitude. Two, intercultural nonverbal communication competence can maximize effective and successful intercultural communication between TESOL teachers and students. Pedagogical implications and coping strategies for TESOL teacher development of intercultural nonverbal communication competence are discussed.

detail.abstract: As businesses finalize their business strategy, the next phase is to execute it. detail.title: Implications of Competition in Quantity-Based Leftover Food Platforms
detail.abstract: On quantity-based leftover food platforms, retailers sell leftovers in bags, where actual food quantities remain uncertain to customers upon receipt. Each retailer's decisions on bag price and size are complicated by: (i) uncertainty in leftover amount while having to ensure a guaranteed minimum bag size, (ii) intricate relationships among contextual factors (e.g., customer quantity demand and unit penalty cost), and (iii) competing retailers' decisions. We develop a game-theoretic model to characterize a retailer's optimal strategies and examine how competition impacts these strategies and resulting outcomes. We show that, under certain conditions, the retailer should shift strategy focus between improving profit margin and reducing total penalties, highlighting the need to carefully balance retailer-, customer-, and platform-specific factors. Interestingly, compared with a no-competition benchmark, the price can be higher and the actual size can be larger under competition, and they can increase as competition intensity increases. More importantly, our analysis yields three key insights on the resulting outcomes. First, competition (versus the no-competition benchmark) can reduce food waste and enhance customer surplus without compromising the retailer's profit under practically relevant scenarios. Second, intense competition can significantly reduce both customer surplus and retailer's profit, and exacerbate food waste (e.g., when the original unit price of the leftover is high and retailers' expected leftover amount is small), suggesting that having more retailers may result in unintended consequences. Third, platforms can mitigate these consequences by leveraging the platform's discount rate, e.g., when retailers' leftover amount is small, a lower discount rate can reduce food waste.

AI.tldr: 研究基于数量的剩余食品平台中零售商的定价与包装策略，分析竞争对策略及结果的影响。
AI.research_question: 在基于数量的剩余食品平台上，零售商如何优化定价和包装策略以应对竞争和不确定性？

AI.theoretical_framework: 博弈论模型用于分析零售商的策略选择及竞争影响。
AI.method: 开发博弈论模型，分析零售商的最优策略及竞争对结果的影响。
AI.findings: 竞争可能提高价格和包装尺寸，并在某些条件下减少食品浪费和增加客户盈余。但激烈竞争可能带来负面影响。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出竞争环境下零售商策略的动态调整理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为平台和零售商提供策略建议，如调整折扣率以优化结果。

title: Development of an Infrastructure Maturity Assessment Model for Wholesale Food Markets
affiliations: Stellenbosch University, Stellenbosch University and Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) - Center for Transportation & Logistics

detail.title: Development of an Infrastructure Maturity Assessment Model for Wholesale Food Markets
detail.abstract: Wholesale food markets are critical hubs in the agrifood supply chain worldwide. However, their efficiency is often constrained by infrastructural deficits. From a logistics perspective, infrastructure in wholesale food markets is responsible for the physical flow of products, information and cash. This research uses the Design Science Research Methodology (DSRM) to iteratively create an infrastructure assessment maturity model, which can help market managers enforce infrastructure improvements. The DSRM process ensured the model's relevance and rigour. The model was validated through semi-structured interviews with experts from the industry. The validated model is divided into three canvasses: (1) a wholesale food market infrastructure framework highlighting all the infrastructures and how their main functions are connected; (2) a general description of the wholesale food market infrastructure maturity model; and (3) a maturity model description based on infrastructure dimensions. The proposed refined model includes five maturity levels, ten infrastructure dimensions, and 36 infrastructure sub-dimensions.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过设计科学研究方法（DSRM）开发了一个批发食品市场基础设施评估成熟度模型，帮助市场管理者推动基础设施改进。模型分为三个部分，包括五个成熟度级别、十个基础设施维度和36个子维度。

AI.motivation: 批发食品市场是全球农产品供应链的关键节点，但其效率常受基础设施不足的限制。
AI.theoretical_framework: 设计科学研究方法（DSRM）和基础设施成熟度模型。
AI.method: 使用DSRM迭代开发模型，并通过半结构化专家访谈验证。
AI.findings: 模型分为三个部分：基础设施框架、成熟度模型概述和基于维度的成熟度模型描述。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一个基于DSRM的基础设施成熟度评估框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为市场管理者提供了改进基础设施的工具和指导。

title: Platform Brands Rising: The Competitive and Perceptual Consequences of Amazon Brand Entry
affiliations: University of Arizona, University of Maryland and University of Arizona

detail.title: Platform Brands Rising: The Competitive and Perceptual Consequences of Amazon Brand Entry

declarations.funderStatement: This research is partially funded by the 2024 ISMS (INFORMS Society for Marketing Science) Doctoral Dissertation Early-Stage Research Grant.

detail.abstract: This study examines the impact of platform brand entry on competing products sold on the platform. In the context of Amazon.com, we identify 66 markets where Amazon introduced its Amazon brands and use a staggered Synthetic Difference-in-Differences (SynthDID) model to estimate the effects on market price, engagement, and consumer perception. We find that entry of Amazon brands significantly reduces market price and price dispersion. For the competing products, the Amazon brand entry increases consumer engagement, measured by the number of product reviews, and improves product ratings. Yet, these competitive gains come at a perception cost: both perceived value and quality decline after the entry of Amazon brands. This suggests that while platform brands stimulate efficiency, they may simultaneously raise consumer expectations and undermine perceived product differentiation. To understand which products are most exposed to this shifting pressure, we implement a panel-adapted Double Machine Learning (DML) framework with multi-modal product embedding. We find that the third-party sellers, who offer moderately similar products to Amazon brand, face the most pronounced negative effects. Our findings generate valuable managerial and policy insights regarding digital platforms and third-party sellers on these platforms.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了平台自有品牌进入对平台上竞争产品的影响。通过分析亚马逊平台上66个市场的案例，研究发现亚马逊自有品牌的进入显著降低了市场价格和价格分散，同时增加了竞争产品的消费者参与度和评分，但降低了其感知价值和品质。
AI.research_question: 平台自有品牌的进入如何影响平台上竞争产品的价格、消费者参与度和感知？
AI.motivation: 探讨平台自有品牌对第三方卖家和市场竞争的动态影响，为平台经济和政策制定提供依据。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于平台经济和品牌竞争的现有理论，结合消费者行为理论。
AI.method: 采用交错合成双重差分法（SynthDID）和面板适应的双机器学习框架（DML）分析数据。
AI.findings: 亚马逊自有品牌进入降低了市场价格和价格分散，增加了竞争产品的消费者参与度和评分，但降低了其感知价值和品质。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了平台自有品牌对市场竞争和消费者感知的理论理解。
AI.practical_contributions: 为平台管理者和政策制定者提供了关于平台自有品牌对第三方卖家影响的实践启示。

title: ­ 50k4life: A Smart Study Protocol to Improve Walking Engagement in Public School Employees on the Us-Mexico Border
affiliations: University of Texas at El Paso, Michigan State University, affiliation not provided to SSRN, University of Georgia, Florida State University, University of Georgia - Department of Health Policy and Management, University of Georgia, affiliation not provided to SSRN, Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center, affiliation not provided to SSRN and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: ­ 50k4life: A Smart Study Protocol to Improve Walking Engagement in Public School Employees on the Us-Mexico Border

keywords: Sequential Multiple Assignment Randomized Trial SMART Design Trial

detail.abstract: IntroductionMexican Americans living in the U.S.-Mexico border region suffer disproportionately from preventable cardiometabolic and cancer diseases. Workplace health promotion programs that include physical activity promotion are promising strategies to address this public health problem to improve physical activity engagement. Workplace-based programs can increase moderate to vigorous physical activity (MVPA) engagement while addressing barriers associated with inactivity.MethodsWe plan to conduct a clustered Sequential Multiple Assignment Randomized Trial (SMART) to determine the effectiveness of a workplace walking challenge intervention – 50,000 for Life (50K4Life) – in improving brisk walking engagement (at least 7,000 steps/day, representing approximately 50,000 steps/week) for public school employees. The two-phase trial will include 30 public schools in two cohorts (15 per cohort) with predominantly Mexican American employees from El Paso County area schools in Texas on the U.S.-Mexico border. In Phase 1, the schools will be randomly assigned to 50K4Life or 50K4Life plus app-based push notifications. In Phase 2, schools with 50% or more participants accumulating 50,000 steps/week will continue receiving the same intervention. The remaining schools will be randomly assigned to receive individual or school-level intervention. As part of our intervention evaluation, we will conduct a process and cost-effectiveness evaluation to provide insight into cost and scalability.DiscussionThis study will provide evidence to support the implementation of walking challenge-based interventions that improve engagement among Mexican Americans living in the U.S.-Mexico border region.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过两阶段随机试验评估工作场所步行挑战干预（50K4Life）对墨西哥裔美国人运动参与的改善效果。
AI.research_question: 工作场所步行挑战干预（50K4Life）是否能有效提高墨西哥裔美国人的运动参与？
AI.motivation: 墨西哥裔美国人在美墨边境地区因缺乏运动而面临较高的可预防疾病风险，工作场所健康促进计划是潜在解决方案。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于工作场所健康促进理论和行为干预理论。
AI.method: 采用两阶段集群随机试验（SMART），评估50K4Life干预的效果，包括步数目标和推送通知。
AI.findings: 研究将提供干预效果、成本效益及可扩展性的证据。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了工作场所健康促进和行为干预的理论应用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为美墨边境地区墨西哥裔美国人的运动促进提供实践指导。

title: Cost-Effective Enforcement of Arbitral Awards under New York Convention
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Cost-Effective Enforcement of Arbitral Awards under New York Convention
detail.abstract:
As arbitration process is claimed to be one of quickest and inexpensive methods to settle dispute, with the motive to reduce to the burden in Courtrooms and enable parties to proceed in an inexpensive manner. To initiate with the arbitral awards inclusive of interim award, it is similar to the court’s judgement, wherein the Arbitrator gives an award playing as judge and it is given by him is should also be implemented likewise. The procedure of the enforcement of the foreign awards in India, is enumerated hereinafter procuring an award, the recipient should halt for tenure of 90 days, as that is limitation period to put upon any objection on the award. Then, the court executed the award as decree, without any objection. In case of International commercial arbitration, party seeking the enforcement of the award should move to the Commercial Department of HC, as the assets or jurisdictional nexus of defendant. With the escalated internationalization, emergence of disputes in an International scale elevated which led to inception of Convention on the Recognition and Enforcement of Foreign Arbitral Award, 1959 [“New York Convention”]. The New York Convention steers an enforcement-oriented mindset for the Courts. The New York Convention permits enforcement of awards by the Court of the Contracting State through in-depth analysis of award not on legitimacy, but on the premise of integrity, rule of law, impartiality and in harmony with the Nation’s policy. The New York Convention lays down a few criteria for enforcement of an award between international parties, through the clause of testing the award and framework for refusal of award.

The aim of this article is to secure the essence of Arbitration, and ensure that hurdles in enforcement procedure can be overcome with acknowledgement of cutting down on procedural expense of the parties and advancing procedure of enforcement. Roadmap of this Article, leads us through analysis of Article 4 and 5 of the New York Convention in next section we examine the procedural halts in these clauses which undermines cost effectivity of this procedure and lastly, we examine approach of foreign courts and insights given by Law Commission of India [“LCI”].

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了仲裁作为快速且经济的争议解决方式，重点分析了外国仲裁裁决在印度的执行程序及《纽约公约》的作用，旨在克服执行障碍并降低程序成本。

AI.method: 分析《纽约公约》条款、执行程序中的障碍及外国法院和印度法律委员会的见解。
AI.findings: 执行程序中的障碍可能增加成本，但《纽约公约》提供了框架以促进高效执行。

title: The Role of Social Media Advertising in Engaging Customers: An Investigation
affiliations: Orange city Institute of management

detail.title: The Role of Social Media Advertising in Engaging Customers: An Investigation
detail.abstract: This research article investigates the impact of social media advertising on customer engagement, emphasizing its crucial role in modern marketing tactics. As social media platforms gain traction, brands are increasingly utilizing these avenues to create meaningful connections with their audience. The study delves into various elements of social media advertising, such as personalized messaging, interactive content formats, and collaborations with influencers, all of which contribute to enhanced customer interaction. By evaluating the effectiveness of these strategies, the paper highlights the necessity of data-driven methods in customizing advertising initiatives to align with consumer preferences. Additionally, the research pinpoints essential performance metrics for assessing engagement and addresses the challenges that brands encounter in the everevolving social media environment. Ultimately, this article seeks to offer valuable insights into how companies can refine their social media advertising strategies to cultivate stronger customer relationships and foster brand loyalty.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了社交媒体广告对客户参与度的影响，强调了其在现代营销策略中的关键作用。研究探讨了社交媒体广告的多个元素，如个性化消息、互动内容形式和与影响者的合作，这些元素共同提升了客户互动。通过评估这些策略的有效性，本文强调了数据驱动方法在定制广告活动中的必要性，并指出了评估参与度的关键绩效指标及品牌在社交媒体环境中面临的挑战。
AI.research_question: 社交媒体广告如何影响客户参与度？
AI.motivation: 随着社交媒体平台的普及，品牌越来越依赖这些渠道与受众建立有意义的联系，因此需要研究如何优化社交媒体广告策略以提升客户参与度和品牌忠诚度。
AI.theoretical_framework: 研究基于现代营销理论和客户参与度理论，探讨社交媒体广告的多个维度及其对客户互动的影响。
AI.method: 研究通过评估社交媒体广告的多种策略（如个性化消息、互动内容和影响者合作）的有效性，采用数据驱动方法分析客户参与度。
AI.findings: 研究发现，个性化消息、互动内容和影响者合作能显著提升客户参与度，同时数据驱动方法对定制广告活动至关重要。
AI.theory_contributions: 研究丰富了社交媒体广告和客户参与度的理论框架，强调了数据驱动方法的重要性。
AI.practical_contributions: 研究为品牌提供了优化社交媒体广告策略的实用建议，帮助提升客户参与度和品牌忠诚度。

title: Operational Metrics in Derivatives Adoption: Evidence from China's Chemical Industry
affiliations: Dongbei University of Finance and Economics, Dongbei University of Finance and Economics and Santa Clara University

detail.title: Operational Metrics in Derivatives Adoption: Evidence from China's Chemical Industry
detail.abstract: This study examines the role of financial derivatives in managing operational and financial risks within China's chemical manufacturing sector. While prior research has primarily focused on financial determinants of hedging decisions, we highlight the significant influence of operational metrics-particularly inventory levels and turnover rates-in shaping firms' engagement in derivatives markets. Drawing from a sample of 289 publicly listed chemical firms from 2016 to 2022, we employ probit regression and K-means clustering to explore how operational and financial factors jointly determine derivatives adoption. Our empirical results reveal that operational metrics have a non-negligible impact on hedging decisions. Specifically, inventory and turnover rates emerge as primary determinants of firms' initiatives, while pre-tax operating profit remains significant from a financial perspective. The moderation analysis of cash flow reveals that financially constrained firms prioritize derivatives for operational risk mitigation, while resource-abundant firms employ them selectively for strategic optimization. Furthermore, our robustness tests, which control for geographical distinctions and the COVID-19 effect, confirm that firm-specific operational characteristics consistently dominate firms' hedging decisions despite regional heterogeneity. Finally, clustering analysis underscores the interplay between operational efficiency and capital robustness, showing that firms exhibiting superior operational efficiency and capital robustness demonstrate higher engagement in derivatives hedging. These findings contribute to the corporate risk management literature by expounding on the primacy of operational considerations in derivatives usage, particularly in asset-intensive industries. The study also provides practical implications for manufacturing firms navigating volatile market conditions, emphasizing that integrating operational and financial strategies is crucial for effective risk management.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了中国化工制造业中金融衍生品在管理运营和财务风险中的作用，发现运营指标（如库存水平和周转率）对企业的衍生品使用决策有显著影响。
AI.research_question: 运营和财务因素如何共同决定化工制造企业对金融衍生品的采用？
AI.motivation: 现有研究主要关注财务因素对套期保值决策的影响，而忽视了运营指标的作用。本研究旨在填补这一空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于企业风险管理和运营效率理论。
AI.method: 采用probit回归和K-means聚类分析，样本为2016-2022年289家上市化工企业。
AI.findings: 运营指标（如库存和周转率）对衍生品使用决策有显著影响；财务约束企业更倾向于使用衍生品缓解运营风险。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了企业风险管理文献，强调了运营因素在衍生品使用中的重要性。
AI.practical_contributions: 为制造业企业在波动市场中的风险管理提供了实践指导，强调运营与财务策略的整合。

title: In the end, Bell always wins… A critical analysis of concentration in Toronto’s fibre-internet service market
affiliations: University of Toronto - Faculty of Information

detail.title: In the end, Bell always wins… A critical analysis of concentration in Toronto’s fibre-internet service market

keywords.keywords: TSP capital construction; capital works; right-of-way access; facilities-based regulation; compensation for use of public space; political economy of regulatory policy

detail.abstract: The following paper presents results of inductive analysis of the capital works undertakings of three fibre-based telecommunications services providers (TSPs) operating in Toronto, Canada between 2012 and 2022. The data was obtained via a freedom of information request submitted to the City of Toronto, and the results highlight the dominance of the market’s incumbent-local-exchange carrier in project and linear length deployments. A comparative analysis of cumulative works is presented by the type of construction activity inclusive of overlapping projects. We draw on a range of legal and regulatory actions to assess and contextualize the TSP works represented in the data, and to advance a critical analysis of the capture of municipal public spaces in furthering federal objectives towards facilities-based competition. We conclude with policy recommendations premised on prospective disclosure of extant capital works data.

AI.tldr: 本文通过归纳分析2012年至2022年间多伦多三家光纤电信服务提供商的资本工程数据，揭示了市场主导者在项目部署中的优势，并结合法律与监管行动，对公共空间占用问题提出政策建议。

title: Within-Firm Job Description Wage Gaps: The Implications for Financial Performance
affiliations: The University of Texas at El Paso

detail.title: Within-Firm Job Description Wage Gaps: The Implications for Financial Performance

publicationDetails.detailsText: Forthcoming in the Australian Journal of Management.

detail.abstract: I study within-firm and job-type wage gaps arising from words in job descriptions using a natural language processing technique (word2vec) on proprietary U.S. job-level wage data from publicly traded companies spanning two decades. Analyzing nearly half a million job descriptions, I find that stereotypically feminine descriptions correspond to lower wages compared to masculine ones, as they require fewer years of experience and less education. At the firm level, wider job description wage gaps---where masculine descriptions earn more---are associated with higher firm value. A difference-in-differences design around Executive Order 13672 supports a plausibly causal interpretation, and the effect is strongest in politically sensitive firms. The wage premium for masculine descriptions is linked to a higher share of skilled jobs, greater productivity, and increased investment.

AI.tldr: 该论文使用自然语言处理技术（word2vec）分析美国上市公司20年间的职位描述数据，发现性别刻板印象导致工资差距：女性化描述的职位工资较低，而男性化描述的职位工资较高。这种差距与公司价值正相关，且在政治敏感公司中表现最强。
AI.research_question: 职位描述中的性别刻板印象如何影响公司内部的工资差距？
AI.motivation: 研究性别刻板印象在工资差距中的作用，揭示其对公司和劳动力市场的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于性别刻板印象理论和劳动力市场分割理论。
AI.method: 使用自然语言处理技术（word2vec）分析近50万条职位描述数据，结合差中分法（difference-in-differences）验证因果关系。
AI.findings: 女性化描述的职位工资较低，男性化描述的职位工资较高；工资差距与公司价值正相关，且在政治敏感公司中表现最强。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了性别刻板印象在工资差距中的作用研究，验证了其对公司和劳动力市场的实际影响。
AI.practical_contributions: 为公司提供关于职位描述设计的政策建议，以减少性别工资差距并提升公司价值。

title: Horizontal Complementarities and Complementor Engagement on Social Media Platforms
affiliations: Meiji Gakuin University and Senshu University

detail.title: Horizontal Complementarities and Complementor Engagement on Social Media Platforms
detail.abstract: This paper examines how the design of horizontal complementarities in social media (SM)-type platforms influences both user engagement and complementor engagement. Drawing on a case study of Pixiv, a Japanese creative content platform, the analysis identifies three key mechanisms through which horizontal complementarities operate: (1) directly promoting user engagement, (2) enhancing complementor engagement, and (3) amplifying complementor engagement via indirect network effects arising from user activity. The findings underscore the strategic importance of designing platform functionalities and category linkages that foster cross-participant interaction. Horizontal complementarities, when effectively implemented, serve not only to enhance the user experience but also to incentivize sustained contributions from complementors, both of which are essential for the long-term growth of SM-type platforms.

title: The Hidden Cost of Firm-Level Political Risk: Impairing Liquidity in Corporate Bond Markets
affiliations: University of Adelaide - Faculty of the Professions, Curtin University and Victorian Institute of Technology

detail.title: The Hidden Cost of Firm-Level Political Risk: Impairing Liquidity in Corporate Bond Markets
detail.abstract: This paper investigates how firm-level political risk affects corporate bond liquidity. Using a large sample of U.S. corporate bonds from 2002 to 2022, we find that higher political risk significantly reduces bond liquidity. The effect is stronger for financially distressed firms, during periods of elevated economic policy uncertainty, and under weak consumer sentiment. It persists across credit ratings but is more pronounced for non-investment-grade bonds. The impact is also greater before the Global Financial Crisis, when macroeconomic intervention was more limited. To address endogeneity, we use terrorist attacks as exogenous shocks to political risk and find consistent evidence supporting causality. These findings position firm-level political risk as a key, underexplored driver of bond market liquidity, enriching the literature on political risk, market functioning, and corporate finance.

title: Factors Triggering Increased Volatility and Risk in Space Commerce
affiliations: Pennsylvania State University - Donald P. Bellisario College of Communications, Pennsylvania State University - Penn State Dickinson Law

detail.title: Factors Triggering Increased Volatility and Risk in Space Commerce
detail.abstract:
Just as outer space appears to have reached a critical mass of investment and popularity, rising environmental, market, and regulatory risks loom. A bifurcated future assessment juxtaposes robust enthusiasm and growing fear, uncertainty, and doubt.

On one hand, space commerce, in 2023, generated an estimated $630 billion in economic activity, rising to a potential $1.8 trillion by 2035. Low Earth Orbiting satellite constellations have the potential to bridge the Digital Divide by providing a reliable infrastructure for widely available and affordable broadband access, even in remote, rural, and impoverished locales throughout the world. Other developing market opportunities include development of a vibrant space launch and tourism industry, mineral extraction from asteroids, colonization of the Moon and Mars, and an expanded array of services via commercial satellites.

However, extraordinary growth in space commerce could quickly evaporate if longstanding and emerging challenges shift from chronic and unresolved, to acute and potentially catastrophic. National governments and private ventures can avoid triggering worst case scenarios only if they immediately and effectively respond to growing risks generated by:

equipping spacecraft with nuclear power and testing weapons irresponsibly;

proliferating space debris;

increasing odds for spacecraft collisions;

toxic emissions generated by spacecraft launches and deorbiting vaporization; and

the growing potential for harmful radio spectrum interference and orbital congestion from several thousand newly launched small, low earth orbiting satellites.

This paper identifies the positive and negative impacts from vast changes in the telecommunications satellite ecosystem. Technological innovations and entrepreneurial skills have substantially eroded longstanding barriers to market entry, competition, and diversification. A large percentage of the more than 10,000 currently orbiting satellites did not exist two years ago. Private ventures, not government-owned and operated enterprises, dominate the space commerce marketplace, many with business plans, readily dismissed as science fiction not long ago.

While the space commerce marketplace has achieved remarkable recent growth and diversification, irrational exuberance has ignored serious, potentially catastrophic, worst-case scenarios. Stakeholders, including governments, have refrained from acknowledging chronic and emerging problems, and in turn, have done nothing to resolve them.

The paper explains how emerging technologies and business plans contribute to both revenue enhancement and greater risk of calamity. It identifies specific environmental, business, and regulatory factors that have positive, negative, conflicting, or uncertain impacts on space commerce. The paper concludes with specific recommendations on what unconditional and immediate commitments national governments and private ventures must make to promote space sustainability.

title: Economic Benefits of Fiber Deployment

detail.title: Economic Benefits of Fiber Deployment
detail.abstract:
Currently, about 62 million Broadband Serviceable Locations (BSLs), which include at least 56 million households – i.e., over half the BSLs and forty percent of the households in the United States, do not have fiber broadband. There is an ongoing debate about the existence and magnitude of economic benefits that would be realized if fiber was deployed to locations that are already served by high-speed broadband, but do not have fiber broadband.
Our study is the first to show that fiber deployment has significant incremental economic benefits even in the presence of other high-speed broadband technologies. The report also argues that because private actors will not capture all the benefits of fiber deployment the marketplace will not deploy enough fiber on its own. Based on these findings we suggest a few policy takeaways.

First, because the social return on investment is higher for fiber, directing more of the existing public funds towards fiber deployment will generate greater economic returns compared to investment in other high-speed broadband technologies such as hybrid fiber-coaxial (HFC). Thus, the various public programs, such as the Rural Digital Opportunity Fund (RDOF), the Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) program, ReConnect, Capital Projects Fund and the federal Broadband Infrastructure Program (BIP), which are prioritizing fiber builds are on the right policy path. This prioritization needs to continue if the gains from deploying fiber are to be realized.

Second, based on available data, our research implies that even if fiber is deployed as an overbuild to existing high-speed technologies, the incremental benefits are sizeable. Thus, when the federal or local governments are measuring the underserved population, one important metric may be using a fiber-unserved metric and not just a speed-based metric. This will allow these entities to better target funding towards a fiber solution.

Third, federal and local governments that promote fiber deployment, such as BIP, Louisiana’s Granting Unserved Municipalities Broadband Opportunities (GUMBO) program and Maine’s ConnectMaine fund, should be encouraged and expanded. Additionally, the focus on fiber that some of these programs have, should be supported, and used as a model for other private-public initiatives.

Last, fiber is a future-proof solution and when the benefits and costs are evaluated on a long-run horizon, fiber becomes the optimal choice for delivering fixed high-speed broadband.

We find that deploying fiber to the 56 million households that are in tracts unserved by fiber, has the potential to generate at least $3.24 trillion in terms of net present value (NPV) in incremental economic impact.

Deploying fiber has the potential to increase housing values by $1.64 trillion (in NPV terms). It could increase average household values between 14% - 17% depending on non-urban versus urban areas. This translates to an average increase of $27,000 - $41,000 per house per year. The effect on housing values in non-urban areas is fives times greater than in urban areas and is driven by the greater number of unserved households in non-urban areas. For the 56 million unserved households, in net present value (NPV) terms, this implies a $1.4 trillion total increase in house values for non-urban areas and $242 billion total increase for urban areas.

Deploying fiber to all fiber-unserved locations can potentially lead to a one-time increase in income by $1.6 trillion (in NPV terms). The income effect comes from non-urban areas. U.S. households in non-urban areas with new access to fiber will likely experience an increase in their average income by $1,450 in one year. This translates to a total increase of $81 billion in one year.

Fiber deployment also has the potential to create at least 380,000 new jobs for the U.S. economy.

Fiber deployment also has a significant impact on remote work, environmental benefits, and is best equipped to handle the increased connectivity needs in a 5G world and beyond. In addition, it improves educational outcomes, reduces health costs (thereby increasing health savings), and accelerates technology adoption.
.
Additionally, a significant advantage of fiber is that it is a future-proof technology due to its ability to provide the critical broadband infrastructure required to deliver high speeds, scalability, reliability, and support for emerging applications and technologies. An optimal lower cost data network today will likely not meet the needs of tomorrow. Consequently, the least costly way of providing a given level of service today may create greater upgrade costs in the future. Fiber has the potential to handle all future capacity needs. Even if it is not the least-costly solution today, the government should target more current funding towards fiber deployment, with an eye towards the future.

detail.title: International Climate Finance: A Quantitative Economic Evaluation
detail.abstract: We quantitatively analyze the effectiveness and optimal design of international climate finance, which is a critical pillar of international climate cooperation. Our multi-county-multi-sector structural trade model incorporates two key climate action channels-clean energy transition and agricultural adaptation to climate change. Using 2017 data, we find that international climate finance of USD 11.8 billion generates substantial returns, increasing global welfare by USD 71.8 billion while reducing carbon emissions by 264 million tonnes. We establish principles to improve the efficiency of both mitigation and adaptation finance allocation within regions, while also providing guidance on the distribution of funds between the two types of finance. Our analysis reveals that international climate finance warrants significant scaling up from current levels.

title: Does Private Equity Hurt or Improve Healthcare Value? New Evidence and Mechanisms
affiliations: University of Texas at Austin, University of Texas at Austin and University of Texas at Austin

detail.title: Does Private Equity Hurt or Improve Healthcare Value? New Evidence and Mechanisms

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare that they have no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper.
declarations.funderStatement: The work reported in this paper is not supported by any funding.

detail.abstract: What is the impact of private equity (PE) investment on healthcare value? Does PE investment hurt or improve healthcare value, and if so, can its effect be mitigated through the use of health information technologies (IT)? Given the significant investments by PE firms in the healthcare sector in recent years, these are important research questions. Stakeholders, including policy makers, care providers, and patients, need to understand their likely impact and whether PE ownership is aligned with their interests. Drawing on resource-based view of the firm and stakeholder theory, we posit that PE investment can both positively and negatively influence healthcare value. More importantly, we argue that IT-enabled health information sharing can help align the interests of PE firms and hospitals with respect to the dual objectives of value-based care-cost reduction and care quality improvement. Using a staggered difference-indifferences approach and data from US hospitals from 2008-2020, we estimate changes in healthcare value following changes in ownership based on PE investment. In general, we observe that the overall value of healthcare delivered by hospitals declines after PE investment. However, our empirical evidence reveals that IT-enabled, health information sharing plays an important moderating role. Hospitals with stronger information-sharing capabilities exhibit greater cost efficiencies and improvements in care quality, leading to higher healthcare value after PE investment. In other words, health information sharing between providers mitigates the potential negative impact of hospital PE ownership on care value. Furthermore, we find that the type of health information sharing matters. Specifically, we observe that improvements in care quality are primarily driven by information sharing between hospitals and ambulatory care providers, instead of simply hospital-to-hospital sharing of patient health data. Our research also identifies the underlying mechanisms through which health information sharing improves care value by reducing hospitalacquired infections and readmission rates, thereby improving care quality, and enhancing labor productivity by reducing operating costs. Our results highlight the critical role of policies and common data standards needed to promote IT-enabled information sharing between healthcare providers, which, in turn, can align incentives of PE firms with the goals of value-based care.

title: Losing grip? The Quantity Theory of Money under Currency Competition
affiliations: Simon Fraser University (SFU) - Department of Economics, University of Ottawa and Washington University in Saint Louis, John M. Olin Business School

detail.title: Losing grip? The Quantity Theory of Money under Currency Competition
detail.abstract: This study examines currency competition between a centrally managed currency, the Dollar, and a rigid-supply alternative, Bitcoin, focusing on the role of monetary policy. Using theoretical modeling and laboratory experiments, we show that proportional transfers, modeled as interest on Dollar balances, increase Dollar trade shares (Dollar dominance) and reduce Dollar velocities, thereby weakening the pass-through of monetary policy to prices. These dynamics are self-fulfilling: low inflation expectations drive trade shifts and slower spending, which in turn suppress Dollar prices. In the lab, we observe how evolving expectations shape trade, velocity, and inflation. Dollar policy induces inflation spillovers into Bitcoin by crowding out trade, despite Bitcoin's lack of a monetary authority, revealing the limits of central bank influence in an increasingly pluralistic monetary system.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了美元（中央银行管理的货币）与比特币（固定供应货币）之间的货币竞争，重点关注货币政策的作用。通过理论建模和实验室实验，研究发现比例转移（模拟为美元余额利息）提高了美元交易份额（美元主导地位）并降低了美元流通速度，从而削弱了货币政策对价格的传导。这些动态是自我实现的：低通胀预期驱动交易转移和支出放缓，进而抑制美元价格。实验中观察到预期如何影响交易、流通速度和通胀。美元政策通过挤出交易导致通胀溢出到比特币，揭示了中央银行在日益多元化的货币体系中影响力的局限性。
AI.research_question: 中央银行管理的货币（美元）与固定供应货币（比特币）之间的竞争如何影响货币政策和价格传导？
AI.motivation: 随着比特币等替代货币的兴起，理解中央银行货币政策在多元化货币体系中的有效性及其对价格的影响变得尤为重要。
AI.theoretical_framework: 货币竞争理论、货币政策传导机制、自我实现的通胀预期。
AI.method: 理论建模与实验室实验相结合，分析比例转移（模拟为美元余额利息）对美元交易份额和流通速度的影响。
AI.findings: 比例转移提高美元交易份额并降低流通速度，削弱货币政策对价格的传导；低通胀预期驱动交易转移和支出放缓，抑制美元价格；美元政策导致通胀溢出到比特币。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了货币竞争背景下货币政策传导的复杂性，以及自我实现预期在价格形成中的作用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为中央银行在多元化货币体系中制定政策提供了参考，强调了货币政策影响力的局限性。

title: Do Local Social Hierarchies Drive Conspicuous Consumption? Exploring the Impact of Dominant Groups on Relative Deprivation among Indian Households
affiliations: IISER Bhopal and Indian Institute of Science Education and Research Bhopal

detail.title: Do Local Social Hierarchies Drive Conspicuous Consumption? Exploring the Impact of Dominant Groups on Relative Deprivation among Indian Households
detail.abstract: Consumption is a vital phenomenon of any economy, but each society's sociocultural and economic norms drive consumption habits and patterns of individuals. Household consumption patterns are more likely driven by the influence of societal comparisons, leading to conspicuous consumption. We propose that the relative social class of households within local reference groups impact their conspicuous consumption. We examine household spending on conspicuous goods to check how the consumption of conspicuous goods by upper-class households, defined by caste, religion, and income categories, affects the consumption of lower-class households in the same neighbourhood. The study also examines whether conspicuous consumption leads to household deprivation regarding beneficial consumption. We found a positive and statistically significant impact of the dominant reference group's conspicuous consumption on individual households' conspicuous consumption. We also found a positive correlation between household conspicuous spending and relative deprivation in essential consumption categories. These results indicate the strong influence of social factors driven by social comparison and peer influence in determining the consumption pattern of Indian households.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了印度家庭中社会比较和同侪影响对炫耀性消费的影响，发现上层家庭的炫耀性消费会显著影响同社区下层家庭的消费行为，并可能导致家庭在基本消费上的相对剥夺。
AI.research_question: 上层家庭（按种姓、宗教和收入划分）的炫耀性消费如何影响同社区下层家庭的炫耀性消费？炫耀性消费是否会导致家庭在有益消费上的相对剥夺？
AI.motivation: 消费是经济的重要组成部分，但社会文化和经济规范会影响个人消费习惯。研究旨在揭示社会比较和同侪影响对家庭消费模式的作用。
AI.theoretical_framework: 社会比较理论和炫耀性消费理论。
AI.method: 通过分析家庭在炫耀性商品上的支出来研究上层家庭对下层家庭的影响，并检验炫耀性消费与基本消费剥夺的关系。
AI.findings: 上层家庭的炫耀性消费对下层家庭有显著正向影响；炫耀性消费与基本消费剥夺呈正相关。
AI.theory_contributions: 验证了社会比较和同侪影响在消费行为中的重要作用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了关于社会不平等和消费模式的洞察，有助于设计减少消费剥夺的政策。

title: Determinants of Total Factor Productivity in Rice Farming: Evidence from Nigeria
affiliations: UNIVERSITY OF ILORIN, UNIVERSITY OF ILORIN, University of Ilorin, UNIVERSITY OF ILORIN and University of Ilorin

detail.title: Determinants of Total Factor Productivity in Rice Farming: Evidence from Nigeria
detail.abstract: Nigeria, despite being the largest rice producer and consumer in Africa, remains dependent on rice imports due to persistent productivity gaps in domestic production. This study investigates the determinants of Total Factor Productivity (TFP) among smallholder rice farmers using data from a cross-sectional survey of 1,577 respondents across major rice-producing states. A log-linear Cobb-Douglas production function was estimated using Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) to identify the contributions of key input and socio-demographic variables to TFP. Key findings reveal that increased use of labor, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, improved seeds, and ploughing significantly enhances productivity-labor alone increases TFP by 11.6%, and pesticides by 17.7%. Conversely, being female, having a larger household, and attaining higher formal education levels are associated with lower TFP. Farming experience (20.7% increase) and participation in government support programs (36.9% increase) positively affect productivity. These findings provide empirical evidence for designing targeted agricultural policies and input support programs that not only enhance rice productivity but also address structural barriers, reduce import dependence, and strengthen national food security.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了尼日利亚小农户水稻生产中全要素生产率（TFP）的决定因素，发现劳动、化肥、农药等投入显著提高生产率，而性别、家庭规模和教育水平则对TFP有负面影响。
AI.research_question: 尼日利亚小农户水稻生产的全要素生产率（TFP）的决定因素是什么？
AI.motivation: 尽管尼日利亚是非洲最大的水稻生产国和消费国，但由于国内生产效率低下，仍依赖进口。研究旨在找出提高生产率的因素以减少进口依赖。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于Cobb-Douglas生产函数，分析投入变量（如劳动、化肥）和社会人口变量（如性别、教育）对TFP的影响。
AI.method: 采用横断面调查数据（1,577名受访者），使用OLS估计对数线性Cobb-Douglas生产函数。
AI.findings: 劳动、化肥、农药等投入显著提高TFP（劳动增加11.6%，农药增加17.7%）；女性、家庭规模大和教育水平高则降低TFP；农业经验和政府支持项目对TFP有正面影响。
AI.theory_contributions: 为农业经济学提供了关于小农户TFP决定因素的实证证据。
AI.practical_contributions: 为制定针对性农业政策和投入支持计划提供依据，以减少进口依赖并增强粮食安全。

title: Emissions Trading with Supply Adjustment Mechanisms and Market Power
affiliations: University of Cologne, Germany, Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research (PIK) and SciencesPo

detail.title: Emissions Trading with Supply Adjustment Mechanisms and Market Power
detail.abstract: Endogenous supply adjustment mechanisms have become a typical feature in permit markets, but their designs differ across markets. We show that incentives for regulated agents who hold market power are contingent on the key policy design choice of the market observable used to condition supply adjustments. Specifically, we develop a stylized dynamic model of a permit market with endogenous supply adjustments and increasing stringency over time, where a subset of agents holds market power. This allows us to draw distinctions between the two main approaches implemented in permit markets today, i.e., quantity-and price-based adjustment mechanisms. Quantity-based adjustments tend to exacerbate potential price distortions from market power. In contrast, price-based adjustments can mitigate them if implemented correctly while remaining active at later market stages. As market power concerns may become increasingly salient as permit market sizes decrease in line with net-zero targets, our results inform the ongoing debate about the design of supply adjustment mechanisms.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了许可市场中内生供应调整机制的设计差异，分析了基于数量和价格的调整机制对市场权力的影响，并指出价格调整机制在正确实施时可缓解价格扭曲。
AI.research_question: 许可市场中基于数量和价格的供应调整机制如何影响市场权力的激励？
AI.motivation: 随着许可市场规模缩小，市场权力问题日益突出，需要研究不同调整机制的设计对市场效率的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 动态许可市场模型，包含内生供应调整和市场权力。
AI.method: 开发了一个动态模型，模拟基于数量和价格的供应调整机制。
AI.findings: 基于数量的调整会加剧市场权力导致的价格扭曲，而基于价格的调整在正确实施时可缓解这一问题。
AI.theory_contributions: 为许可市场供应调整机制的设计提供了理论依据。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者在设计许可市场调整机制时提供了实用建议。

title: Strategies for Sustainable Growth in the Thames Gateway
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Strategies for Sustainable Growth in the Thames Gateway
detail.abstract: This paper explores the application of sustainable development principles in the Thames Gateway regeneration initiative, which took place in east London and the counties of Kent and Essex during the late 2000s. The Thames Gateway was a central element of the New Labour Government's strategy to regenerate and stimulate economic growth in these areas between 1997 and 2010, building on earlier efforts by the Conservative administration in developing east London's Docklands. The research draws on policy analysis, documentary review, and interviews with stakeholders involved in sustainability initiatives and decision-making. The study identified four distinctive but overlapping and complementary strategies for integrating environmental priorities into urban regeneration and economic growth strategies: socially cohesive growth, low-carbon growth, accommodated growth, and integrated growth. This typology offers an interpretive framework for analysing different approaches to sustainable urban development.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了可持续发展原则在泰晤士河口再生计划中的应用，分析了四种互补策略以整合环境优先事项。
AI.research_question: 泰晤士河口再生计划中如何应用可持续发展原则？
AI.motivation: 研究旨在填补可持续发展原则在城市再生和经济增长策略中的应用空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 可持续发展理论、城市再生理论。
AI.method: 政策分析、文献综述、利益相关者访谈。
AI.findings: 识别了四种互补策略：社会凝聚增长、低碳增长、适应增长和综合增长。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一个分析可持续城市发展方法的解释性框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了整合环境优先事项的具体策略。

title: The Fourth Power: Neo-Federal Technocratic Governance and National Productive Capitalism for Future Iran
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: The Fourth Power: Neo-Federal Technocratic Governance and National Productive Capitalism for Future Iran

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author is an undergraduate economics student and affirms that this paper was produced independently without external funding or institutional influence. No competing interests are declared.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study does not involve human participants or sensitive data. Therefore, ethics approval was not required.

detail.abstract:
Iran’s centralized governance model has historically failed to address regional inequalities, economic instability, and social discontent, as evidenced by disparities between provinces like Tehran and Sistan-Baluchistan (Clingendael Institute, 2025), and environmental crises such as the drying of Lake Urmia (United Nations Environment Programme, 2012). This paper proposes a novel framework for Iran’s future governance and economic system, combining federalism with technocratic governance and National Productive Capitalism (NPC).                   

The model decentralizes power through autonomous states with local constitutions, ensuring regional autonomy while maintaining national unity. A Supreme Council of Wisdom, comprising experts, guides long-term policy to ensure technocratic decision-making. NPC emphasizes sustainable economic development through green investments, progressive taxation, and state-private partnerships, with specific revenue-sharing formulas to reduce regional disparities. Citizen-centered mechanisms, including symbolic shareholding and an Independent Human Rights Commission, enhance transparency and accountability.                                           

The methodology involves a review of comparative literature on federalism (e.g., Riker, 1964; Watts, 1999), technocratic governance (e.g., Centeno & Silva, 1998), and developmental capitalism (e.g., Rodrik, 2007; UNEP, 2011), alongside hypothetical case scenarios for regions like Gilan, Khuzestan, and Kurdistan. Key findings suggest that this integrated model could enhance regional GDP, reduce inequality (measured by the Gini coefficient), and improve environmental metrics. A three-year transitional roadmap outlines implementation from interim governance to full elections. The discussion addresses political feasibility, economic risks, and comparative lessons from federal systems like Germany and India. The paper concludes by highlighting the model’s strengths and recommending actionable steps for academia, civil society, and international partners, while calling for further scholarly debate and pilot projects.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种结合联邦制与技术官僚治理及国家生产性资本主义（NPC）的新框架，旨在解决伊朗的区域不平等、经济不稳定和社会不满问题。通过权力下放、专家指导和可持续经济政策，该模型有望提升区域GDP、减少不平等并改善环境指标。
AI.research_question: 如何通过联邦制与技术官僚治理及NPC的结合，解决伊朗的区域不平等、经济不稳定和社会不满问题？
AI.motivation: 伊朗的中央集权治理模式未能有效解决区域不平等、经济不稳定和社会不满，亟需一种新的治理框架。
AI.theoretical_framework: 联邦制（Riker, 1964; Watts, 1999）、技术官僚治理（Centeno & Silva, 1998）、发展型资本主义（Rodrik, 2007; UNEP, 2011）。
AI.method: 文献综述与假设性案例研究（如吉兰、胡齐斯坦和库尔德斯坦）。
AI.findings: 该模型可能提升区域GDP、减少不平等（基尼系数）并改善环境指标。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了结合联邦制、技术官僚治理和NPC的新治理框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为伊朗的治理改革提供了具体实施方案，包括过渡路线图和政策建议。

title: ІНВЕСТУВАННЯ НА РИНКУ FINTECH (Investment in the Fintech Market)
affiliations: State Tax University

detail.title: ІНВЕСТУВАННЯ НА РИНКУ FINTECH (Investment in the Fintech Market)
detail.abstract:
Ukrainian Abstract: Статтю присвячено дослідженню теоретичних та практичних аспектів реалізації інвестицій на ринку FinTech. Окреслено передумови інтеграції цифрових технологій у фінансовий ринок, що сприяє його цифровій трансформації, підвищує якість та доступність фінансових послуг. Розглянуто підходи до класифікації сегментів ринку FinTech. Приділено увагу функціональному призначенню ринку FinTech. З огляду на визначені переваги та швидкий розвиток ринку цифрових технологій зростає його інвестиційна привабливість. Оцінено загальні тенденції інвестування на ринку FinTech у світі. Розставлено акценти у територіальному розподілі світових центрів інвестування у цифрові технології. Описано особливості розвитку інвестування на ринку FinTech України. Приділено увагу виокремленню ключових перепон та стримуючих чинників інвестування у цифрові технології в Україні, серед яких низький рівень цифрової інклюзії та обмежений доступ до джерел фінансування інвестиційної діяльності. Зазначені перепони знаходять своє відображення в активності інвестування, структурі фінансування та розвитку сегментів українського ринку FinTech. Подальші наукові дослідження спрямовуються на окреслення перспектив розвитку ринку FinTech, а також вивчення можливостей поглиблення інтеграції українського ринку у світовий ринок цифрових технологій.

English Abstract: The article is dedicated to studying the theoretical and practical aspects of investment implementation in the FinTech market. It outlines the prerequisites for integrating digital technologies into the financial market, which promotes its digital transformation and improves the quality and accessibility of financial services. Approaches to classifying FinTech market segments are examined. Attention is given to the functional purpose of the FinTech market. Given the identified advantages and rapid development of the digital technology market, its investment attractiveness is increasing. General trends in FinTech market investment worldwide are assessed. Emphasis is placed on the territorial distribution of global centers investing in digital technologies. The specifics of investment development in Ukraine’s FinTech market are described. Key barriers and restraining factors for investment in digital technologies in Ukraine are highlighted, including low levels of digital inclusion and limited access to sources of investment financing. These barriers are reflected in investment activity, financing structure, and the development of segments in Ukraine’s FinTech market. Further research is focused on outlining the prospects for FinTech market development and exploring the potential for deeper integration of Ukraine’s market into the global digital technology market.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了FinTech市场中投资的理论与实践，探讨了数字技术整合对金融市场的促进作用，分析了全球FinTech投资趋势及乌克兰市场的特点与挑战。
AI.research_question: FinTech市场中投资的理论与实践如何影响金融市场的数字化变革？
AI.motivation: 随着数字技术的快速发展，FinTech市场的投资吸引力增强，但乌克兰市场面临独特的挑战，需深入研究。
AI.theoretical_framework: 数字技术整合理论、FinTech市场分类理论、投资吸引力理论。
AI.method: 文献综述与市场趋势分析。
AI.findings: 数字技术整合提升了金融服务的质量与可及性，但乌克兰市场的低数字包容性和融资限制阻碍了投资。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了FinTech市场投资的理论框架，特别是对新兴市场的分析。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者和投资者提供了乌克兰FinTech市场的现状与未来发展方向。

title: ІНСТИТУЦІЙНІ ОСНОВИ ОРГАНІЗАЦІЇ ФОНДОВОГО РИНКУ УКРАЇНИ (Institutional Foundations of the Organization of Ukraine’s Stock Market)
affiliations: State Tax University and State Scientific Research Institute for Informatization and Economic Modeling

detail.title: ІНСТИТУЦІЙНІ ОСНОВИ ОРГАНІЗАЦІЇ ФОНДОВОГО РИНКУ УКРАЇНИ (Institutional Foundations of the Organization of Ukraine’s Stock Market)
detail.abstract:
Ukrainian Abstract: Актуальність статті зумовлена необхідністю активізації фінансово-інвестиційного потенціалу фондового ринку України, що залишався малорозвиненим і зазнав негативного впливу під час воєнного стану. У роботі систематизовано інституційні засади організації фондового ринку, зокрема в умовах воєнного періоду, та розглянуто ключові зміни в регуляторному підході. Пріоритет надано ролі фондового ринку як механізму мобілізації інвестиційних ресурсів в умовах економічної та геополітичної нестабільності. Описано основні нормативно-правові акти та повноваження державних органів у сфері регулювання. Виокремлено дві групи проблем фондового ринку: системні (залежні від стану економіки) та організаційні (які можна вирішити державним втручанням). Запропоновано шляхи вдосконалення ринку: диверсифікація інструментів, розвиток корпоративного сегменту, підвищення ліквідності, довіри інвесторів і фінансової грамотності. Наведено очікувані результати від впровадження запропонованих заходів.

English Abstract: The relevance of the article lies in the need to unlock the financial and investment potential of Ukraine’s stock market, which has remained underdeveloped and was further impacted by martial law. The study systematizes the institutional foundations of the stock market’s organization, particularly under wartime conditions, and highlights key changes in regulatory approaches. Priority is given to the stock market’s role as a mechanism for mobilizing investment resources amid economic and geopolitical instability. The article outlines key legal acts and the responsibilities of regulatory authorities. It identifies two categories of stock market issues: systemic (linked to the overall economic situation) and organizational (addressable through state regulation). Proposed solutions include diversification of financial instruments, development of the corporate segment, improved liquidity, investor trust, and financial literacy. The expected outcomes of the suggested regulatory measures are also presented.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了乌克兰股市在战时条件下的金融与投资潜力激活问题，提出了改进市场的具体措施。
AI.research_question: 如何激活乌克兰股市的金融与投资潜力，尤其是在战时条件下？
AI.motivation: 乌克兰股市发展不足且受战争影响，亟需通过制度改进激活其潜力。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于制度经济学和金融市场理论，分析股市的组织与监管。
AI.method: 系统化分析股市的制度基础、监管变化及战时条件下的挑战。

title: Algorithmic Coercion with Faster Pricing
affiliations: University of Michigan and University of Virginia - Department of Economics

detail.title: Algorithmic Coercion with Faster Pricing
detail.abstract:
We examine a model in which one firm uses a pricing algorithm that enables faster pricing and multi-period commitment. We characterize a coercive equilibrium in which the algorithmic firm maximizes its profits subject to the incentive compatibility constraint of its rival. By adopting an algorithm that enables faster pricing and (imperfect) commitment, a firm can unilaterally induce substantially higher equilibrium prices even when its rival maximizes short-run profits and cannot collude. The algorithmic firm can earn profits that exceed its share of collusive profits, and coercive equilibrium outcomes can be worse for consumers than collusive outcomes. In extensions, we incorporate simple learning by the rival, and we explore the implications for platform design.

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author declares no competing interests.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study does not involve any human participants or animal subjects and uses only publicly available secondary data. No ethics approval is required.
declarations.funderStatement: This research did not receive any specific grant from funding agencies in the public, commercial, or not-for-profit sectors.

detail.abstract: This study examines the impact of railway infrastructure on internal migration across local authorities in England and Wales. Employing spatial analysis with Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) regression, the research quantifies how railway amenities, compared alongside modern, historical, and natural amenities, influence migration inflows. The findings indicate significant regional heterogeneity, with railway track length positively influencing migration, especially in densely populated areas and regions characterized by higher unemployment, elevated housing prices, and a stronger preference for remaining in the EU. Robustness checks using instrumental variables confirm these results but also reveal complexities concerning the effects of railway stations. The outcomes emphasize the necessity for integrated infrastructure planning to ensure balanced regional demographic and economic development.

title: Integrating Indigenous Women into Global Trade: Legal Reforms as a Viable Solution
affiliations: Dharmashastra National Law University, Jabalpur - Dharmashastra National Law University, Jabalpur, Students and Dharmashastra National Law University, Jabalpur - Dharmashastra National Law University, Jabalpur, Students

detail.title: Integrating Indigenous Women into Global Trade: Legal Reforms as a Viable Solution
detail.abstract: The world is facing changing patterns in global trade and climate. The global understanding of climate change is that it is a challenge. International trade is affected by the impacts of climate change, yet it also acts as a catalyst due to its contribution to deforestation, carbon emissions, and pollution. Thus, it becomes important to introduce sustainable reforms in trade and its growth to ensure that its alignment is such that it fulfils the objectives of the Sustainable Development Goals. The paper introduces one such reform: integrating Indigenous women into mainstream trade. Indigenous women have refined cultural, social, and economic consciousness connected to nature’s revival and sustenance. The paper aims to highlight why there is a need for sustenance in International Trade and elucidate how Indigenous women, the backbone of society, can serve as facilitators. The paper analyses the current challenges faced in international trade and how Indigenous women can significantly mitigate those challenges if provided with apt legal reforms. This idea is unique in that Indigenous women are being brought into commerce for the sake of improving commerce itself, and not merely in response to their vulnerable situation or to keep them fed. With that said, the seriousness of their marginalisation cannot be underestimated. While Indigenous women have been victims and the vulnerable amongst the vulnerable, they should also be valued for the contribution they can make. When the aboriginal ideas of Indigenous women are shared and protected, it will facilitate inclusive growth in the globalised world. The paper explores how Indigenous women contribute from around the globe by presenting a cross-country study. The paper also draws attention to the legal abyss in current legal frameworks, in incorporating Indigenous women into international trade and how reforms are fundamentally required in the current legal landscape to foster this idea. Reforms in international trade law are the most viable and effective solutions for integrating Indigenous women. The paper further intricately scrutinises the current legal landscape to bring out policy suggestions. The recommendations aim to create a space where Indigenous women and trade could benefit together.

title: Recommendation for a National Carbon Pricing Mechanism: The Hybrid Upstream-Downstream Model

detail.title: Recommendation for a National Carbon Pricing Mechanism: The Hybrid Upstream-Downstream Model
detail.abstract: To solidify Malaysia's role as a climate leader and gain a decisive economic edge in response to global pressures like the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM), this paper proposes a pragmatic and equitable hybrid carbon tax framework for implementation starting in 2026. This forward-thinking model provides a clear roadmap that harness existing institutions by integrating an upstream tax on fuels for power generation, administered by the Royal Malaysian Customs Department (JKDM), with a downstream tax on industrial emissions, managed by the Inland Revenue Board (LHDN). To ensure the highest standards of transparency and international credibility, the entire framework will be anchored by a worldclass digital Monitoring, Reporting, and Verification (MRV) system overseen by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Sustainability (NRES). The policy introduces a predictable carbon price, starting at RM40/tCO₂e, to give industries the certainty needed for green technology investments. It is carefully designed to protect economic stability through mechanisms that prevent double taxation and support trade-exposed industries. Critically, 100% of the revenue will be reinvested directly into the economy. This will be achieved through a "Carbon Dividend," providing cash assistance to households, and a "Green Growth" fund to empower industrial innovation. This ensures a just transition that accelerates Malaysia's decarbonization, enhances national competitiveness, and directly benefits all communities. .
